indication.disease: Recurrent/Metastatic Head & Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
indication.line: 1L with platinum/5-FU, monotherapy after platinum failure

direct_competitors.rationale: Established 1L standard replacing cetuximab-based EXTREME in PD-L1–positive disease and broadly used regardless of HPV status.

direct_competitors.status: FDA approved (1L for CPS ≥1; later-line regardless of CPS)
direct_competitors.rationale: Preferred 1L option in CPS ≥1 and CPS ≥20, directly displacing cetuximab-containing regimens.
Standard after platinum failure, reducing later-line cetuximab monotherapy use.
Competes for later-line use where cetuximab monotherapy was historically used.

key_biomarkers.clinical_utility: Selects 1L pembrolizumab monotherapy (CPS ≥1) and enriches benefit for pembrolizumab ± chemo; informs IO vs cetuximab regimens.
key_biomarkers.prevalence: CPS ≥1 in ~70–85% of R/M HNSCC; CPS ≥20 in ~30–35%

key_biomarkers.clinical_utility: Prognostic; HPV+ disease has better outcomes and may influence treatment intensity and expectations.
key_biomarkers.prevalence: HPV+ in ~60–70% of oropharyngeal; lower in oral cavity/larynx

key_biomarkers.clinical_utility: Identifies candidates for farnesyl transferase inhibition (e.g., tipifarnib) in R/M setting.
key_biomarkers.prevalence: ~4–8% overall; enriched in oral cavity primaries

key_biomarkers.clinical_utility: Tissue-agnostic indication for pembrolizumab (TMB ≥10 mut/Mb) may support IO use when PD-L1 is low/negative.
Biologic rationale for EGFR targeting (cetuximab, emerging EGFR engagers/ADCs); not a robust predictive marker.

hpv_stratification.treatment_differences: Pembrolizumab ± chemo remains preferred in 1L; de-escalation strategies are investigational. Cetuximab-based regimens used less often in 1L.
Higher-risk biology; pembrolizumab + chemotherapy commonly favored in CPS-low/negative disease; cetuximab usage largely limited to select cases.

paradigm_shifts.new: Pembrolizumab ± platinum/5-FU as preferred 1L based on PD-L1 CPS
paradigm_shifts.impact: Material loss of 1L share for cetuximab-containing regimens; repositioned mainly to non-IO niches or combinations.

paradigm_shifts.old: Cytotoxic chemotherapy as standard after platinum failure
paradigm_shifts.new: PD-1 inhibitors (nivolumab, pembrolizumab) in post-platinum disease
PD-L1 CPS and HPV/p16 status routinely considered in 1L decisions
paradigm_shifts.impact: Shifts prescribing from cetuximab toward PD-1–based regimens in eligible patients.

settings: Definitive chemoradiation for locally advanced disease
exclusions.rationale: Non-R/M settings not competitive with recurrent/metastatic indication
